newsitem.title: DENMARK: FORECAST - Danske Bank sees higher Danish '97 GDP.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST - Danske Bank sees higher Danish '97 GDP.

text.p: In its latest survey Den Danske Bank on Wednesday raised its expectations for Denmark's 1997 GDP (gross domestic product) growth to 3.1 percent from 2.8 percent in its last forecast in March.

At the same time it lowered its inflation forecast for this year to 2.2 percent from 2.3 percent, raising to 14.8 billion crowns its previous estimate of a current account surplus of 9.1 billion crowns
The latest Danish Economy Ministry forecast in May foresaw 3.3 percent GDP growth, 2.3 percent inflation, 7.8 percent unemployment and a current account surplus of 12.0 billion crowns for this year.
The following estimates were made by 10 leading local and international organisations in recent months.
